candidates.title: Update dependencies.
candidates.body:
*  Switch routecore and rpki to published versions.
*  Remove unused simple-logging.
*  Run "cargo update".

candidates.title: Upgrade to Clap 3. Set MSRV to 1.54.
Add additional metrics to RTR units.
candidates.body:
This PR adds additional metrics to the `"rtr"` and `"rtr-tls"` units providing information about the last update received from upstream as well as the number of bytes exchanged.

Fixes #25.

candidates.title: Introduce support for manipulating payload sets.
candidates.body:
This PR changes how payload sets are stored to make it possible to relatively cheaply manipulate them as they progress through the unit graph.

It introduces the notion of sets, blocks, and packs. A _pack_ is a shareable, ordered sequence of unique payload elements. A  _block_ is shareable reference to a consecutive portion of a pack. Finally, a _set_ is a sequence of blocks chosen in such a way that it, too, is an ordered sequence of unique payload elements.

Elements can be filtered from a set and additional blocks can be added to a set. In both cases, the result is a new set with blocks from the old and new blocks split up and entwined in such a way as to make a valid set.

While at it, the PR also changes the payload type to those introduced in rpki-rs 0.14 which introduces support for BGPsec and prepares for support for ASPA.

Finally, as a side-effect of having to adjust serialization to work with the new types, the `json` unit now understands the JSON format produced by newer versions of rpki-client.

candidates.title: RPM packaging
candidates.body: Initial workflow, Cargo.toml and supporting files. Will likely need tweaking to fix whatever breaks when run by GitHub Actions. Based heavily on RPM support recently added for Routinator.

candidates.title: Update dependencies to Tokio 1.0 and rpki-rs 0.11.
Initial attempt at DEB packaging for RTRTR.
candidates.body:
Creates a home dir as Lintian insists when using `--system` that `--home` also be used. Includes a default `/etc/rtrtr.conf` config file that logs to syslog and uses an any unit with no sources, intended to be customized by the user and so the installed systemd service is not enabled by default.

Includes a Routinator based GH Actions `pkg` workflow to create packages ala how it is done for Routinator and Krill. Packaging and use of the package was tested locally on my Ubuntu Bionic machine building the package in an Ubuntu Xenial Docker container and then installing and running it in an Ubuntu Xenial LXC container.

README.md has NOT been updated yet.
